result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Mario O Morales was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
A withheld sentence, eighteen (18) months probation and mandatory minimum jail as a condition of probation. Entrance into and completion of the OWI Court program as a condition of probation. 
-------------------------

miscConds.notes:
$600.00 fine plus costs. THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE. Payment is due within 30 days. If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan. Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines/costs as ordered. *NOTE: fine may be increased to $1,200.00 fine plus costs, if probation is revoked.
------------------------

**AMENDMENT 02-05-2015 - IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the Defendant shall provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
----------------------

Defendant MUST follow all OWI Court Program, Jail and Probation rules with no violations. Any violation of rules or failure to adhere to treatment requirements could mean removal from the OWI Court Program, revocation of probation, and an immediate imposition of the remaining jail sentence. Such sentence MUST be served within the Walworth County Huber Facility.
---------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
-------------------

timeConds.notes:
Initial mandatory minimum jail sentence to be completed at the Walworth County jail Huber Facility. This conditional jail time may be served on electronic monitoring at the discretion of the Walworth County Jail.
----------------------

Total Bond covers 14CF359, 14CM184, 14CM236, 14CT21, 14CT187, and 14CT188.  Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH J.T. OR HIS RESIDENCE.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
